    • Number LaserCode
    • Number Duration

    Returns

    • SPOT

    POSITIONABLE:LaseOff(Target)

    Stop Lasing a POSITIONABLE

    Parameters

    • POSITIONABLE self
    • POSITIONABLE Target

    Returns

    • POSITIONABLE

    POSITIONABLE:IsLasing()

    Check if the POSITIONABLE is lasing a target

    Parameters

    • POSITIONABLE self

    Returns

    • Boolean true if it is lasing a target

    DCSPositionable Class

    The DCSPositionable class does not inherit

    Attributes

    • id_ The : ID of the controllable in DCS

    Wrapper.Scenery Module

    This module contains the SCENERY class.

    1) SCENERY class, extends POSITIONABLE

    Scenery objects are defined on the map. The SCENERY class is a wrapper class to handle the DCS Scenery objects:

    • Wraps the DCS Scenery objects.
    • Support all DCS Scenery APIs.
    • Enhance with Scenery specific APIs not in the DCS API set.

    Wrapper.Static Module

    This module contains the STATIC class.

    1) STATIC class, extends POSITIONABLE

    Statics are Static Units defined within the Mission Editor. Note that Statics are almost the same as Units, but they don't have a controller. The STATIC class is a wrapper class to handle the DCS Static objects:

    • Wraps the DCS Static objects.
    • Support all DCS Static APIs.
    • Enhance with Static specific APIs not in the DCS API set.
    1.1) STATIC reference methods

    For each DCS Static will have a STATIC wrapper object (instance) within the _DATABASE object. This is done at the beginning of the mission (when the mission starts).

    The STATIC class does not contain a :New() method, rather it provides :Find() methods to retrieve the object reference using the Static Name.

    Another thing to know is that STATIC objects do not "contain" the DCS Static object. The STATIc methods will reference the DCS Static object by name when it is needed during API execution. If the DCS Static object does not exist or is nil, the STATIC methods will return nil and log an exception in the DCS.log file.

    The STATIc class provides the following functions to retrieve quickly the relevant STATIC instance:

    • STATIC:FindByName(): Find a STATIC instance from the _DATABASE object using a DCS Static name.

    IMPORTANT: ONE SHOULD NEVER SANATIZE these STATIC OBJECT REFERENCES! (make the STATIC object references nil).

    STATIC Class

    Inheritance : The STATIC Class inherits from the following parents :
BASE
    `-- OBJECT
        `-- IDENTIFIABLE
            `-- POSITIONABLE
                `-- STATIC

    STATIC:FindByName(StaticName, RaiseError)

    Finds a STATIC from the _DATABASE using the relevant Static Name. As an optional parameter, a briefing text can be given also.

    Parameters

    • STATIC self
    • String StaticName : Name of the DCS Static as defined within the Mission Editor.
    • Boolean RaiseError : Raise an error if not found.

    Returns

    • STATIC

    Wrapper.Unit Module

    Wrapper - UNIT is a wrapper class for the DCS Class Unit.

    The UNIT class is a wrapper class to handle the DCS Unit objects:

    • Support all DCS Unit APIs.
    • Enhance with Unit specific APIs not in the DCS Unit API set.
    • Handle local Unit Controller.
    • Manage the "state" of the DCS Unit.

    UNIT Class

    Inheritance : The UNIT Class inherits from the following parents :
BASE
    `-- OBJECT
        `-- IDENTIFIABLE
            `-- POSITIONABLE
                `-- CONTROLLABLE
                    `-- UNIT

    UNIT:Register(UnitName)

    Create a new UNIT from DCSUnit.

    Parameters

    • UNIT self
    • String UnitName : The name of the DCS unit.

    Returns

    • UNIT

    UNIT:Find(DCSUnit)

    Finds a UNIT from the _DATABASE using a DCSUnit object.

    Parameters

    • UNIT self
    • Dcs.DCSWrapper.Unit#Unit DCSUnit : An existing DCS Unit object reference.

    Returns

    • UNIT

    UNIT:FindByName(UnitName)

    Find a UNIT in the _DATABASE using the name of an existing DCS Unit.

    Parameters

    • UNIT self
    • String UnitName : The Unit Name.

    Returns

    • UNIT

    UNIT:Name()

    Return the name of the UNIT.

    Parameters

    • UNIT self

    Returns

    • String The UNIT name.

    UNIT:GetDCSObject()

    Parameters

    • UNIT self

    Returns

    • Dcs.DCSWrapper.Unit#Unit

    UNIT:ReSpawn(SpawnVec3, Heading)

    Respawn the Unit using a (tweaked) template of the parent Group.

    This function will:

    • Get the current position and heading of the group.
    • When the unit is alive, it will tweak the template x, y and heading coordinates of the group and the embedded units to the current units positions.
    • Then it will respawn the re-modelled group.

    Parameters

    • UNIT self
    • Vec3 SpawnVec3 : The position where to Spawn the new Unit at.
    • Number Heading : The heading of the unit respawn.

    Returns

    UNIT:IsActive()

    Returns if the unit is activated.

    Parameters

    • UNIT self

    Returns

    • Boolean true if Unit is activated.
    • Nil The DCS Unit is not existing or alive.

    UNIT:IsAlive()

    Returns if the Unit is alive. If the Unit is not alive, nil is returned. If the Unit is alive and active, true is returned. If the Unit is alive but not active, false is returned.

    Parameters

    • UNIT self

    Returns

    • Boolean true if Unit is alive and active.
    • Boolean false if Unit is alive but not active.
    • Nil if the Unit is not existing or is not alive.

    UNIT:GetCallsign()

    Returns the Unit's callsign - the localized string.

    Parameters

    • UNIT self

    Returns

    • String The Callsign of the Unit.
    • Nil The DCS Unit is not existing or alive.

    UNIT:GetPlayerName()

    Returns name of the player that control the unit or nil if the unit is controlled by A.I.

    Parameters

    • UNIT self

    Returns

    • String Player Name
    • Nil The DCS Unit is not existing or alive.

    UNIT:GetNumber()

    Returns the unit's number in the group. The number is the same number the unit has in ME. It may not be changed during the mission. If any unit in the group is destroyed, the numbers of another units will not be changed.

    Parameters

    • UNIT self

    Returns

    • Number The Unit number.
    • Nil The DCS Unit is not existing or alive.

    UNIT:GetGroup()

    Returns the unit's group if it exist and nil otherwise.

    Parameters

    • UNIT self

    Returns

    • GROUP The Group of the Unit.
    • Nil The DCS Unit is not existing or alive.

    UNIT:GetPrefix()

    Returns the prefix name of the DCS Unit. A prefix name is a part of the name before a '#'-sign. DCS Units spawned with the SPAWN class contain a '#'-sign to indicate the end of the (base) DCS Unit name. The spawn sequence number and unit number are contained within the name after the '#' sign.

    Parameters

    • UNIT self

    Returns

    • String The name of the DCS Unit.
    • Nil The DCS Unit is not existing or alive.

    UNIT:GetAmmo()

    Returns the Unit's ammunition.

    Parameters

    • UNIT self

    Returns

    • Dcs.DCSWrapper.Unit#Unit.Ammo
    • Nil The DCS Unit is not existing or alive.

    UNIT:GetSensors()

    Returns the unit sensors.

    Parameters

    • UNIT self

    Returns

    • Dcs.DCSWrapper.Unit#Unit.Sensors
    • Nil The DCS Unit is not existing or alive.

    UNIT:HasSensors()

    Returns if the unit has sensors of a certain type.

    Parameters

    • UNIT self

    Returns

    • Boolean returns true if the unit has specified types of sensors. This function is more preferable than Unit.getSensors() if you don't want to get information about all the unit's sensors, and just want to check if the unit has specified types of sensors.
    • Nil The DCS Unit is not existing or alive.

    UNIT:HasSEAD()

    Returns if the unit is SEADable.

    Parameters

    • UNIT self

    Returns

    • Boolean returns true if the unit is SEADable.
    • Nil The DCS Unit is not existing or alive.

    UNIT:GetRadar()

    Returns two values:

    • First value indicates if at least one of the unit's radar(s) is on.
    • Second value is the object of the radar's interest. Not nil only if at least one radar of the unit is tracking a target.

    Parameters

    • UNIT self

    Returns

    • Boolean self Indicates if at least one of the unit's radar(s) is on.
    • Dcs.DCSWrapper.Object#Object The object of the radar's interest. Not nil only if at least one radar of the unit is tracking a target.
    • Nil The DCS Unit is not existing or alive.

    UNIT:GetFuel()

    Returns relative amount of fuel (from 0.0 to 1.0) the unit has in its internal tanks. If there are additional fuel tanks the value may be greater than 1.0.

    Parameters

    • UNIT self

    Returns

    • Number The relative amount of fuel (from 0.0 to 1.0).
    • Nil The DCS Unit is not existing or alive.

    UNIT:GetUnits()

    Returns the UNIT in a UNIT list of one element.

    Parameters

    • UNIT self

    Returns

    • #list The UNITs wrappers.

    UNIT:GetLife()

    Returns the unit's health. Dead units has health <= 1.0.

    Parameters

    • UNIT self

    Returns

    • Number The Unit's health value.
    • Nil The DCS Unit is not existing or alive.

    UNIT:GetLife0()

    Returns the Unit's initial health.

    Parameters

    • UNIT self

    Returns

    • Number The Unit's initial health value.
    • Nil The DCS Unit is not existing or alive.

    UNIT:GetCategoryName()

    Returns the category name of the #UNIT.

    Parameters

    • UNIT self

    Returns

    • String Category name = Helicopter, Airplane, Ground Unit, Ship

    UNIT:GetThreatLevel()

    Returns the Unit's A2G threat level on a scale from 1 to 10 ... The following threat levels are foreseen:

    • Threat level 0: Unit is unarmed.
    • Threat level 1: Unit is infantry.
    • Threat level 2: Unit is an infantry vehicle.
    • Threat level 3: Unit is ground artillery.
    • Threat level 4: Unit is a tank.
    • Threat level 5: Unit is a modern tank or ifv with ATGM.
    • Threat level 6: Unit is a AAA.
    • Threat level 7: Unit is a SAM or manpad, IR guided.
    • Threat level 8: Unit is a Short Range SAM, radar guided.
    • Threat level 9: Unit is a Medium Range SAM, radar guided.
    • Threat level 10: Unit is a Long Range SAM, radar guided.

    Parameters

    • UNIT self

    Returns

    UNIT:IsInZone(Zone)

    Returns true if the unit is within a Zone.

    Parameters

    • UNIT self
    • ZONE_BASE Zone : The zone to test.

    Returns

    • Boolean Returns true if the unit is within the ZONE_BASE

    UNIT:IsNotInZone(Zone)

    Returns true if the unit is not within a Zone.

    Parameters

    • UNIT self
    • ZONE_BASE Zone : The zone to test.

    Returns

    • Boolean Returns true if the unit is not within the ZONE_BASE

    UNIT:OtherUnitInRadius(AwaitUnit, The)

    Returns true if there is an other DCS Unit within a radius of the current 2D point of the DCS Unit.

    Parameters

    • UNIT self
    • UNIT AwaitUnit : The other UNIT wrapper object.
    • Radius The : radius in meters with the DCS Unit in the centre.

    Returns

    • true If the other DCS Unit is within the radius of the 2D point of the DCS Unit.
    • Nil The DCS Unit is not existing or alive.

    UNIT:IsAir()

    Returns if the unit is of an air category. If the unit is a helicopter or a plane, then this method will return true, otherwise false.

    Parameters

    • UNIT self

    Returns

    • Boolean Air category evaluation result.

    UNIT:IsGround()

    Returns if the unit is of an ground category. If the unit is a ground vehicle or infantry, this method will return true, otherwise false.

    Parameters

    • UNIT self

    Returns

    • Boolean Ground category evaluation result.

    UNIT:IsFriendly()

    Returns if the unit is a friendly unit.

    Parameters

    • UNIT self

    Returns

    • Boolean IsFriendly evaluation result.

    UNIT:IsShip()

    Returns if the unit is of a ship category. If the unit is a ship, this method will return true, otherwise false.

    Parameters

    • UNIT self

    Returns

    • Boolean Ship category evaluation result.

    UNIT:InAir()

    Returns true if the UNIT is in the air.

    Parameters

    • UNIT self

    Returns

    • Boolean true if in the air.
    • Nil The UNIT is not existing or alive.

    UNIT:HandleEvent(Event, EventFunction)

    • UNIT self

    Returns

    • UNIT

    Unit.SensorType Class

    • IRST self
    • RWR self
